attributes.text:
The Toolbar class is the main part of the toolbar widget.

It can handle added {@link Button}s, {@link CheckBox}es, {@link RadioButton}s and {@link Separator}s in its {@link #add} method. The {@link #addSpacer} method adds a spacer at the current toolbar position. This means that the widgets added after the method call of {@link #addSpacer} are aligned to the right of the toolbar.

For more details on the documentation of the toolbar widget, take a look at the documentation of the {@link qx.ui.toolbar}-Package.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property spacing.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applySpacing}.
Return if a menu could be opend on haver or not.
true if a menu could be opend, false otherwise.
true if a menu could be opend, false otherwise.
Indicate if a menu could be opend on haver or not.
Adds a separator to the toolbar.
Add a spacer to the toolbar. The spacer has a flex value of one and will stretch to the available space.
The newly added spacer object. A reference to the spacer is needed to remove this spacer from the layout.
Returns all nested buttons which contains a menu to show. This is mainly used for keyboard support.
List of all menu buttons

Returns the (computed) value of the property openMenu.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #openMenu}.
(Computed) value of openMenu.

Returns the (computed) value of the property show.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.
(Computed) value of show.

Returns the (computed) value of the property spacing.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacing}.
(Computed) value of spacing.
Initial value for property openMenu.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property openMenu with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #openMenu}.
the default value
Initial value for property show.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property show with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.
the default value
Initial value for property spacing.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property spacing with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacing}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property openMenu.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #openMenu}.

Resets the user value of the property show.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacing}.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #openMenu}.
The unmodified incoming value.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.
The unmodified incoming value.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacing}.

Appearance of the widget

Whether icons, labels, both or none should be shown.
The spacing between every child of the toolbar
